intro: Sphaeranthus crispus, commonly known as the crinkled pincushion, is a flowering plant native to Africa, particularly South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common sight in arid environments. Its leaves are often crinkled and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sphaeranthus crispus is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
